Questions.Question: Which legendary musician is known as the 'King of Rock and Roll'?
Questions.Explanation: Elvis Presley, often referred to as the 'King of Rock and Roll,' revolutionized popular music in the 1950s.

Questions.Question: Who was the lead vocalist of the band Queen?
Questions.Explanation: Freddie Mercury was the charismatic lead vocalist of the iconic band Queen, known for his powerful voice and stage presence.

Questions.Question: Which musician is known for his iconic song 'Imagine'?
Questions.Explanation: John Lennon, one of the members of The Beatles, wrote and performed the iconic song 'Imagine' as a solo artist.

Questions.Question: Who is considered the 'Queen of Soul'?
Questions.Explanation: Aretha Franklin, known as the 'Queen of Soul,' was a highly influential singer and songwriter in the soul and R&B genres.

Questions.Question: Which musician is known for his hit song 'Purple Haze'?
Questions.Explanation: Jimi Hendrix, a legendary guitarist, is known for his innovative style and hit song 'Purple Haze' in the 1960s.

Questions.Question: Who is the 'Godfather of Soul'?
Questions.Explanation: James Brown, known as the 'Godfather of Soul,' was a prominent figure in the development of funk music.

Questions.Question: Which musician is known for his album 'Thriller'?
Questions.Explanation: Michael Jackson, often referred to as the 'King of Pop,' released the highly successful album 'Thriller' in 1982.

Questions.Question: Who is the lead guitarist of the band Led Zeppelin?
Questions.Explanation: Jimmy Page is the lead guitarist of the legendary rock band Led Zeppelin, known for his iconic riffs and solos.

Questions.Question: Which musician is known for his song 'Blowin' in the Wind'?
Questions.Explanation: Bob Dylan, a highly influential singer-songwriter, wrote and performed the iconic song 'Blowin' in the Wind.'

Questions.Question: Who is known as the 'King of Pop'?
Questions.Explanation: Michael Jackson earned the title 'King of Pop' due to his immense popularity and impact on the music industry.

Questions.Question: Which musician is known for his album 'Born to Run'?
Questions.Explanation: Bruce Springsteen, often referred to as 'The Boss,' released the critically acclaimed album 'Born to Run' in 1975.

Questions.Question: Who is the lead vocalist of the band The Rolling Stones?
Questions.Explanation: Mick Jagger is the lead vocalist of the iconic rock band The Rolling Stones, known for his energetic performances.

Questions.Question: Which musician is known for his song 'Purple Rain'?
Questions.Explanation: Prince, a highly talented musician, wrote and performed the iconic song 'Purple Rain' in 1984.

Questions.Question: Who is known as the 'Queen of Pop'?
Questions.Explanation: Madonna, a highly influential artist, earned the title 'Queen of Pop' due to her successful career and impact on popular music.

Questions.Question: Which musician is known for his album 'Pet Sounds'?
Questions.Explanation: Brian Wilson, a member of The Beach Boys, is known for his influential album 'Pet Sounds' released in 1966.

Questions.Question: Who is the lead vocalist of the band U2?
Questions.Explanation: Bono, whose real name is Paul Hewson, is the lead vocalist of the Irish rock band U2.

Questions.Question: Which musician is known for his song 'Hey Jude'?
Questions.Explanation: Paul McCartney, one of the members of The Beatles, wrote and performed the iconic song 'Hey Jude.'

Questions.Question: Who is known as the 'King of the Blues'?
Questions.Explanation: B.B. King, a highly influential guitarist and singer, earned the title 'King of the Blues' for his contributions to the genre.

Questions.Question: Which musician is known for his album 'The Wall'?
Questions.Explanation: Roger Waters, a member of Pink Floyd, is known for his concept album 'The Wall' released in 1979.

Questions.Question: Who is the lead vocalist of the band Nirvana?
Questions.Explanation: Kurt Cobain was the lead vocalist and guitarist of the influential grunge band Nirvana.

Questions.Question: Which musician is known for his song 'Rocket Man'?
Questions.Explanation: Elton John, a highly successful singer-songwriter, wrote and performed the iconic song 'Rocket Man.'
